description: The LAFD Girls Camp is a 2-day introductory fire camp for high school girls ages 14-18.

youth_program: HEART - Homeless Engagement and Response Team
description: Provide homeless youth record clearance events to connect with services and remove barriers to housing, education, and employment.
Raise awareness and enforces human trafficking laws.
Provides crime prevention strategies to protect communities, including local youth, through community engagement and partnerships.
Addresses safety on and around school campuses by working in partnership with LAPD, school police, and the community, and through the prosecution of crimes.
Youth tobacco cessation and enforcement program to reduce tobacco sales and use, including e-cigarettes and juuling.

Educates students, parents, and guardians regarding legal obligations to attend school; assesses for factors contributing to absenteeism; connects youth with services; enforces truancy laws as necessary to gain compliance.

youth_program: City Clerk Community Civic Engagement and Voter Registration Outreach

description: Supports artists in providing community-based, participatory projects throughout the City of Los Angeles. The free and low cost classes/workshops produced and presented by the 30-40 different artists funded by this program are intended to gather, connect, and inspire the well-being of target audiences.
A literacy program seeking to inspire youth to become lifeline readers while helping them make connections to the City they call home.

DCA's Cultural Grant Program funds non-profit arts organizations and festival-organizers to produce and present free or low cost activities for youth, families, and seniors. More than 290 organizations are supported and they provide more than 1200 activities in all districts.
Provides students with summer job opportunities in government and non-government jobs.
This program is designed for young men and women who have gained experience through our progressive pathway and are ready to commit to what it takes to become a firefighter.

department: Housing Authority of the City of Los Angeles
description: Provides various youth wellness and development programing.

department: Housing Authority of the City of Los Angeles
description: An intensive college guidance program targeted to youth ages 15-20 residing in participating public housing communities. Provide college readiness counselling and assistance.

description: An intensive college guidance program targeting youth ages 15-20 residing in participating public housing communities.
Partnership between the City of Los Angeles and Los Angeles area colleges and universities which gives youth real world experience tackling tough City problems using research and data analytics.
Both LAX and Van Nuys Airports participate in a number of career fairs throughout the year. The goal is to broaden students' outlook and inform them of career fields in aviation.
Provides trainings, workshops, and work readiness counselling and support services.

youth_program: Full STEAM (Science Technology Engineering Art Math) Ahead
description: Program aimed at encouraging communication, collaboration, critical thinking, and creativity, and include topics such as simple robotics, stop-motion animation, 3D design and printing, Virtual and Augmented Reality, content creation and Citizen Science.
Storytime program series that demonstrates to parents early literacy skills in action and emphasizes hands-on exploration and learning with free materials that participants can take home.

Spreads awareness on early literacy to expecting parents and those with infants under one year old. New parents will read, talk, play, write and sing with their babies and come to the library for free information, and resources.
Brings children and adults together from diverse cultural, ethnic, and socioeconomic backgrounds to share in the joy of reading.
Provides students with educational services to improve study skills, help them prepare for college entrance exams, and help with college applications.
Fun, free and inclusive reading programs designed to mitigate "summer slide" and keep participants engaged in reading during summer and winter breaks.

Held in conjunction with the Library’s "Summer at the Library" program, the Your Author program series strives to inspire and motivate young readers by giving them the opportunity to meet and connect with distinguished local authors and illustrators. Contact your local library branch for more information.

Youth can earn community service hours, and gain leadership and project management skills by assisting in planning teen library programs and projects, designing/decorating teen library spaces, recommending items for teen library collections, and more.

Professionally trained, experienced tutors provide free online homework help to students in grades K-12, as well as adult learners and Spanish speakers, in a range of subjects every day from 11 a.m. to 11 p.m.
Provides teens with community service hours and the opportunity to gain personal and character development experience in volunteering in various library programs, projects and events.

Developmentally appropriate equipment and enhancements to the picture book area of each branch library. Encourages caregivers and young children to engage in the five early literacy skills: talking, reading, writing, singing, and playing while in the library.
Gang prevention services for youth 10-15 years old who are at the highest risk for gang joining and their families.

youth_program: Gang Reduction & Youth Development (GRYD-Gang Intervention Services)
description: Gang intervention services for youth/young adults (ages 14-24-who are gang involved/affiliated and their families).
Locally hires 11 youth at each of the 32 SNL locations as seasonal employees to plan and implement programming Department of Recreation and Parks programing.
Reentry services for gang involved youth ages 14-21, starting 90 days before release from juvenile hall/camp placement.
Pre-arrest diversion services for youth 12-17; all youth, regardless of any gang affiliation will be eligible. Pilot program with this grant will be in LAPD Southeast Division.

youth_program: Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD-Community Safety Partnership (CSP))
description: Program aimed at fostering the Los Angeles Police Department's relationships with the residents in the Jordan Downs, Nickerson Gardens, Imperial Courts, and Ramona Gardens housing communities.

youth_program: Los Angeles Conservation Corps Clean and Green
description: Hires youth to provide litter cleanup, weed abatement, graffiti removal, and alley cleanup services, and to assist with community outreach and special events.

youth_program: Summer Introduction to Engineering and Science Program 2019
description: A six-week summer program designed to groom High School students with an interest in Science, Technology, Engineering or Math to pursue careers in the environmental field.
Provide summer lunches to youth at approximately 100 recreational centers.
Provides employment to youth ages 15 and over as locker room attendants, pool clerks, and lifeguards. Employment is primarily during the summer months.

Walk to School Days celebrate the fun and health benefits of walking to school, while reinforcing the importance of traffic safety. They bring together families, district and school personnel, and community members.
Provides subsidized charter bus trips to recreational, educational and cultural sites to organized groups of youth, seniors, and individual with disabilities.

youth_program: College and Vocational Student Bikeshare Passes
description: Provides qualified students discounted monthly bikeshare passes.
Traffic control officers direct elementary school children crossing streets going to and from school at designated crossings at designated times.

youth_program: Pedestrian and Bicycle Safety Physical Education Program
description: A LAUSD Physical Education curriculum that includes pedestrian and bike safety education and on-bike skills training via PE teachers and team teaching with certified bicycle instructors.
An application-based pilot program that enables residents to temporarily close down their streets to cars and transform them into places for play, learning, and fitness.

A coordinated effort between City departments and LAUSD to provide safer routes to school for the highest need LAUSD schools.  Activities include traffic engineering improvements, enforcement, and education.
Provides easily digestible traffic safety messaging and in-school activities to encourage and reinforce safe, responsible walking and bicycle riding to reduce severe injury and fatal traffic crashes.
Teaches traffic safety knowledge, responsible behavior and good traffic safety acumen through interactive pedestrian and bicycle safety activity that uses a life-size replica of a small neighborhood.
Interactive school assemblies that provide 4th and 5th grade students with a pedestrian safety education.
